title: Creative Sports Inquiry Project Integrated with Nature

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental science principles (physics, ecology) and group activity experience
context.additional_context: A team-based process of creatively designing and implementing sports techniques in natural environments, emphasizing data collection and analysis via digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can observe physical phenomena (friction, gravity, etc.) occurring during sports activities in natural environments and explain them using scientific principles.
Learners can collaborate with team members to design creative sports tools using natural materials and test them with over 80% success rate.
Learners can measure sports activity data using digital devices (smartphones/tablets), visualize it as graphs, and analyze the results.

resources: Natural learning spaces (grass fields, forest trails, etc.)
Digital measurement devices (speedometers, protractor apps, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
